blog.name: lisk-art
blog.title: Lisk's Atelier
blog.description:
Stina Liskow, 25, hobby artist, illustrator and photographer.

Based in Germany.

My favorite medium to use is watercolor and I cronecly hoard watercolor papers. Right now I am into Critical Role!

.

Commissions: Open

Requests: Maybe

Trades: Maybe

Any questions? Feel free to ask ❤

Languages English and German

summary: Ok the last one for today and sorry for spamming. I tried to work with a few outlines as possible. For this small practice, I...
caption:
Ok the last one for today and sorry for spamming. I tried to work with a few outlines as possible. For this small practice, I picked my favorite soft boii.


*still screaming over the flowers in Zemnian*

I am on Twitter and Instagram -> @ Lisk_Art

blog.name: captain-narava-felidae-riggs
blog.title: The tide has washed the nice from me
blog.description: WOW/SWTOR. Captain Narava of both worlds. Goblin. My hobbies include: Crying while watching hockey, crying while watching Critical Role, and crying while watching Glee clips on YouTube. Also knitting. Over 40 and cool with it. Perniciously Aneimic, hella anxious, depressed widow, biromantic demisexual . Slytherin. OTP: Narava/Corso, Alt OTP: Avarane/Corso, Completely different fandom otp: Perc'ahlia. Pens/Stanley Cup. She/her. Unless you’re Taliesin Jaffe, I’m not interested.

blog.name: yee-hawlw
blog.title: i wanna be a cowboy babeyy

summary: Hot Take but i don't think yasha has lived in the wilds her entire life to me Intelligence is book smarts while Wisdom is...
body:
Hot Take but i don’t think yasha has lived in the wilds her entire life

to me Intelligence is book smarts while Wisdom is street smarts. someone who grew up in the wilds of xhjorhas would probably have a higher Wisdom modifier than Intelligence, but yasha doesn’t. 

i don’t think yasha is secretly rich or whatever, if anything i’d say she was probably small-town middle class. but either way i bet that yasha went to school, maybe even took sword fighting lessons

also it’s worth noting that yasha’s was not born in the sky spear’s tribe. she arrived there and got a name, Orphan Maker. maybe the name Orphan Maker has something to do with why she had to leave her old town?

tags: a wonderful verbal middle finger if ever there was one
summary: One of my favorite Laura and Liam on-stream moments was when he gave her a replica flying broom as a birthday present: I love...
body:
One of my favorite Laura and Liam on-stream moments was when he gave her a replica flying broom as a birthday present:

I love this moment not just because it made Laura so happy, or because the gift tag said “Happy birthday, Twinnie, fly high!” 

But also because Laura had been getting crap for weeks from “fans” on the internet for everything to do with the broom, and Liam looked straight at the camera and said to her: “I’m a big fan of all your decisions. Keep making them.”

summary: The Sapphire of the Sea I just want all the soft moments, I guess.  Also, I love the fact that Caleb called Jester Blueberry...
body:
The Sapphire of the Sea

I just want all the soft moments, I guess.  Also, I love the fact that Caleb called Jester Blueberry (even if it was literally only once)

“One more drink, Blueberry?” Caleb slurred as the tiefling slid into the seat next to him.

“Can you handle it, Caleb?” Jester teased.

Caleb started at her fangs, seemingly mesmerized by the way they gleamed in the light.  He didn’t realize how long he was staring until she sang his name.

“Caaleb,  do you want a drink or not?”

He cleared his throat, “Ja.  Ja, I do.”

Jester flashed one more smile before bounding off to the bar.  He didn’t know if it was the adrenaline still running through him from winning another fight or the alcohol making its way through his system, it didn’t matter he wanted to do everything he shouldn’t tonight.

“One drink for the very drunk, stinky man.”

An amber drink found its way to Caleb’s hand and then into his mouth.  The burn wasn’t as bad as the first time.

“Are you having a drink, Blueberry?” the wizard smiled through his haze.

“Technically, I am technically,” Jester raised her glass of milk.  "The bartender said it is special milk.  A White Zemnian.“

Caleb laughed, full heartedly laughed.  The kind of laugh he never thought he would actually be able to have again.  "Oh Blueberry, do you know what a White Zemnian is?”

“Not normal milk, I don’t think,” Jester’s face twisted at the drink.  "I don’t think I like this too much.“

Caleb’s laugh continued, "You know you don’t have to finish that.”

“No I think I will.  After all, it was made just for me,” Jester sipped at her drink a little more.  "It’s special.“

They fell into a nice silence.  In the distance they could hear Beau shouting for a fight, Nott looking for anything stronger than what she could afford, and Caduceus taking a very drunk Fjord to bed.  Yasha was, Yasha may have Yashaed at this point, they would find out in the morning.  Jester continued sipping her drink and Caleb just stared at the cleric.  Something akin to amazement clouded his eyes the longer he stared at her.  

"Would you like to dance with me?”

Caleb didn’t realize he said that out loud until Jester was nodding her head vigorously and dragging him into the middle of the bar room.

“There’s no music, Caleb,” Jester laughed as they began to sway.

“You could always sing, Blueberry.”

“I’m not good at it.  I’m not like Mama,” she blushed.

Caleb began to move them in circles around the bar, “You may not be the Ruby of the Sea, but you are the Sapphire of the Sea.”

The title he bestowed upon her set something off inside of Jester. A wave of an emotion she never truly felt before started to roll through her, she couldn’t name it exactly, but it was new and exciting.

Jester looked at him through her lashes.  Her violet eyes clashing with his blue ones.  His face was so sincere and his voice so soft.  She smiled and began to sing a song.  One her mother used to song to her.  The only song her mom would sing just for her and nobody else:  her lullaby.

She sang only for the two of them, her voice never going above a whisper.  Jester’s head rested against Caleb’s chest, tucked perfectly under his chin.  They danced like that for what seemed like hours.  The warmth of the Caleb and the coolness of Jester’s skin made a perfect combination for the two of them.  It was as if nothing could get them away from the world the two of them were slowly starting to create.  The only thing that was able to separate them was Beau getting thrown at their feet.

She staggered up, wiping blood from her mouth, “Is that all you got?”

“Beauregard, I think that’s enough,” Caleb whispered.

“Yeah, Beau let’s go to sleep,” Jester reached for Beau, casting cure wounds.

“Good night, Caleb,” Jester smiled as she helped Beau up to their room.

“Good night, Jester,” he smiled back.  The ghost of her song still lingering in his ears.

The Sapphire of the Sea

I just want all the soft moments, I guess.  Also, I love the fact that Caleb called Jester Blueberry (even if it was literally only once)

“Can you handle it, Caleb?” Jester teased.

Caleb started at her fangs, seemingly mesmerized by the way they gleamed in the light.  He didn’t realize how long he was staring until she sang his name.

“Caaleb,  do you want a drink or not?”

The Sapphire of the Sea

I just want all the soft moments, I guess.  Also, I love the fact that Caleb called Jester Blueberry (even if it was literally only once)

“One more drink, Blueberry?” Caleb slurred as the tiefling slid into the seat next to him.

“Can you handle it, Caleb?” Jester teased.

Caleb started at her fangs, seemingly mesmerized by the way they gleamed in the light.  He didn’t realize how long he was staring until she sang his name.

“Caaleb,  do you want a drink or not?”

He cleared his throat, “Ja.  Ja, I do.”

Jester flashed one more smile before bounding off to the bar.  He didn’t know if it was the adrenaline still running through him from winning another fight or the alcohol making its way through his system, it didn’t matter he wanted to do everything he shouldn’t tonight.

“One drink for the very drunk, stinky man.”

An amber drink found its way to Caleb’s hand and then into his mouth.  The burn wasn’t as bad as the first time.

“Are you having a drink, Blueberry?” the wizard smiled through his haze.

“Technically, I am technically,” Jester raised her glass of milk.  "The bartender said it is special milk.  A White Zemnian.“

Caleb laughed, full heartedly laughed.  The kind of laugh he never thought he would actually be able to have again.  "Oh Blueberry, do you know what a White Zemnian is?”

“Not normal milk, I don’t think,” Jester’s face twisted at the drink.  "I don’t think I like this too much.“

Caleb’s laugh continued, "You know you don’t have to finish that.”

“No I think I will.  After all, it was made just for me,” Jester sipped at her drink a little more.  "It’s special.“

They fell into a nice silence.  In the distance they could hear Beau shouting for a fight, Nott looking for anything stronger than what she could afford, and Caduceus taking a very drunk Fjord to bed.  Yasha was, Yasha may have Yashaed at this point, they would find out in the morning.  Jester continued sipping her drink and Caleb just stared at the cleric.  Something akin to amazement clouded his eyes the longer he stared at her.  

"Would you like to dance with me?”

Caleb didn’t realize he said that out loud until Jester was nodding her head vigorously and dragging him into the middle of the bar room.

“There’s no music, Caleb,” Jester laughed as they began to sway.

“You could always sing, Blueberry.”

“I’m not good at it.  I’m not like Mama,” she blushed.

Caleb began to move them in circles around the bar, “You may not be the Ruby of the Sea, but you are the Sapphire of the Sea.”

The title he bestowed upon her set something off inside of Jester. A wave of an emotion she never truly felt before started to roll through her, she couldn’t name it exactly, but it was new and exciting.

Jester looked at him through her lashes.  Her violet eyes clashing with his blue ones.  His face was so sincere and his voice so soft.  She smiled and began to sing a song.  One her mother used to song to her.  The only song her mom would sing just for her and nobody else:  her lullaby.

She sang only for the two of them, her voice never going above a whisper.  Jester’s head rested against Caleb’s chest, tucked perfectly under his chin.  They danced like that for what seemed like hours.  The warmth of the Caleb and the coolness of Jester’s skin made a perfect combination for the two of them.  It was as if nothing could get them away from the world the two of them were slowly starting to create.  The only thing that was able to separate them was Beau getting thrown at their feet.

She staggered up, wiping blood from her mouth, “Is that all you got?”

“Beauregard, I think that’s enough,” Caleb whispered.

“Yeah, Beau let’s go to sleep,” Jester reached for Beau, casting cure wounds.

“Good night, Caleb,” Jester smiled as she helped Beau up to their room.

“Good night, Jester,” he smiled back.  The ghost of her song still lingering in his ears.
trail.content_abstract:
The Sapphire of the Sea

I just want all the soft moments, I guess.  Also, I love the fact that Caleb called Jester Blueberry (even if it was literally only once)

“One more drink, Blueberry?” Caleb slurred as the tiefling slid into the seat next to him.

“Can you handle it, Caleb?” Jester teased.

Caleb started at her fangs, seemingly mesmerized by the way they gleamed in the light.  He didn’t realize how long he was staring until she sang his name.

“Caaleb,  do you want a drink or not?”

Love y’all
